resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
maxburke commented on pull request #6724: ARROW-8225: [rust] Rust Arrow IPC reader must respect continuation markers.
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6724
 
 
   A continuation marker (value of 0xffffffff) in a message size block is
   used to align the next block to an 8-byte boundary. This value needs to
   be skipped over if encountered.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

maxburke commented on issue #6791: ARROW-8225: [Rust] Continuation marker check was in wrong location.
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6791#issuecomment-606876479
 
 
   Hm; these errors popped up but I'm not sure why they're happening?
   
   ```
   32 | |
   33 | | #[tonic::async_trait]
      | |_____________________^ missing `DoExchangeStream`, `do_exchange` in implementation
      |
      = help: implement the missing item: `type DoExchangeStream = Type;`
      = help: implement the missing item: `fn do_exchange(&'life0 self, _: tonic::request::Request<tonic::codec::decode::Streaming<flight::FlightData>>) -> std::pin::Pin<std::boxed::Box<(dyn core::future::future::Future<Output = std::result::Result<tonic::response::Response<<Self as flight::flight_service_server::FlightService>::DoExchangeStream>, tonic::status::Status>> + std::marker::Send + 'async_trait)>> { unimplemented!() }`
   ```
   
   Is the trunk broken?

maxburke commented on issue #6791: ARROW-8225: [Rust] Continuation marker check was in wrong location.
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6791#issuecomment-607437570
 
 
   @nevi-me https://arrow.apache.org/docs/format/Columnar.html
   
   ```
   The encapsulated binary message format is as follows:
   
   A 32-bit continuation indicator. The value 0xFFFFFFFF indicates a valid message. This component was introduced in version 0.15.0 in part to address the 8-byte alignment requirement of Flatbuffers
   
   A 32-bit little-endian length prefix indicating the metadata size
   
   The message metadata as using the Message type defined in Message.fbs
   
   Padding bytes to an 8-byte boundary
   
   The message body, whose length must be a multiple of 8 bytes
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.

fields.description:
A continuation marker (value of 0xffffffff) in a message size block is
 used to align the next block to an 8-byte boundary. This value needs to
 be skipped over if encountered.
fields.summary: [Rust] IPC reader must respect continuation markers
